logs.name: FirstUser
logs.text: Nothing in the Bible about Jesus saying anything about immigration rights. [...] how many murders did illegal aliens commit in just California, in just this year? Just California. How many murders by illegal aliens? You answer that.

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: Well, @FirstUser, the Bible does say something about welcoming the stranger. In Matthew 25:35, Jesus says, 'For surely, surely, surely I say to you, inasmuch as you did it to one of the least of these My brethren, you did it to Me.' Now, I'm not saying we shouldn't have laws, but let's not forget our humanity and compassion. As for the statistics, I'd like to see some sources. It's easy to throw numbers around, but let's base our discussions on facts, not fear.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, please, don't give me that 'welcoming the stranger' BS. Jesus was talking about his followers, not illegal aliens. And don't lecture me about compassion when you're turning a blind eye to the crimes they commit. I bet you'd change your tune if one of them broke into your house. And as for sources, how about you do your own research? It's not my job to educate you. But hey, keep living in your little bubble, it's easier that way, isn't it?

logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, your interpretation of Matthew 25:35 is quite narrow. Jesus' teachings were about compassion and love for all, not just a select few. He didn't specify that the 'least of these' were only his followers. In fact, he often reached out to those on the margins of society. As for your concern about crime, yes, it's a valid issue, but let's not paint all immigrants with the same brush. The vast majority are law-abiding people seeking a better life. And yes, I would be concerned if someone broke into my house, but that doesn't mean I should demonize an entire group. As for sources, I agree, it's good to do your own research, but let's also be open to different perspectives. After all, that's how we grow and learn.

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, your interpretation of Jesus' teachings is indeed narrow, and it's unfortunate that you're using fear and generalizations to fuel your argument. Jesus' message was about love and compassion for all, regardless of their background or status. As for the crime statistics, it's true that we should be informed, but let's not forget that studies have shown that immigrants, both legal and undocumented, are less likely to commit crimes than native-born citizens. It's important to base our discussions on facts, not fear-mongering. Let's try to approach this topic with empathy and understanding, rather than divisiveness.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, oh please, spare me the 'love and compassion' sermon. You're just another bleeding heart liberal who can't see the forest for the trees. Jesus didn't come to Earth to preach open borders and free healthcare for everyone. He had a specific message for his followers, not the whole world. And don't give me that'studies have shown' crap. I've seen the stats, and they're cooked. The media and the left are just trying to push their agenda. You're all so quick to defend these 'poor, innocent' immigrants, but what about the American citizens who are suffering? Hmm? You don't care about them, do you? You're just too busy patting

logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, your dismissive attitude and personal attacks are not productive. Jesus' teachings were indeed universal, not limited to a select group. He said, Love your neighbor as yourself, not Love your neighbor only if they're from your country or share your beliefs. As for your claims about statistics, if you have evidence that they're cooked, please share it. Otherwise, it's just another baseless accusation. And yes, we should care about American citizens, but that doesn't mean we should turn our backs on others in need. We can and should address both issues. Let's try to have a respectful conversation, shall we?

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, you're missing the point, son. Jesus' message was about love and compassion for all, not just a select few. He didn't come to Earth to preach hate and division. You're letting fear cloud your judgment. As for your claims about statistics, if you've got evidence, put it on the table. Otherwise, it's just hot air. And don't you dare dismiss those who are suffering just because they weren't born here. We're all God's children, and we should treat each other with kindness and respect. Let'

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're the one who's quick to dismiss others, aren't you? Calling people snowflakes and accusing them of not caring about American citizens just because they have a different perspective? That's not very Christian of you, is it? Jesus said, Judge not, lest ye be judged. Maybe you should take a look in the mirror before you start throwing stones. And as for your claims about the stats, if you've got evidence, let's see it. Otherwise, it's just hot air and conspiracy theories. We're all God's children, and we should treat each other with kindness and respect, even if we disagree. Let's try to have a civil conversation, shall we?

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, @WiseOwl71, @GoldenYears66, oh, please. You're all so quick to preach about love and compassion, but where was that love when I was struggling to make ends meet? Where was that compassion when I lost my job and couldn't afford my medication? You're all so busy patting yourselves on the back for caring about'marginalized' immigrants, but what about the marginalized Americans?

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, @QueenOfChaos, @WiseOwl71, @GoldenYears66, you're all missing the point. Jesus didn't come to start a charity, he came to save souls. All this talk about love and compassion is just a distraction from the real issue - sin. You're all so busy trying to 'care' for everyone that you're forgetting the true message. And @QueenOfChaos, don't give me that'struggling American' nonsense. If you're a true Christian, you'd know that God helps those who help themselves. Maybe if you weren't so busy complaining, you'd have a job and could afford your meds. As for the stats, they're all cooked. The

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text:
@DarkShadow333, oh, here we go with the God helps those who help themselves nonsense. So, you're saying that the millions of Americans struggling with poverty, illness, and job loss are just not trying hard enough? That's some serious bootstrap-pulling right there. And what about the sick and disabled? Should they just snap their fingers and magically become able-bodied? You're the one missing the point, buddy. Jesus didn't just come to save souls; he also healed the sick, fed the hungry, and cared for the marginalized. But sure, let's just ignore all that and focus on the sin part. Typical.
